2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (18:56): hi sickness, how's the live media project going?
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (18:57): I've been able to rebuild the /usr part and to make some more modifications
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (18:57): anyway, I'll look forward to the next version if it will be possible to go fully 64bit
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (18:57): I saw your e-mails w/ Moinak on the list. Cool.
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (18:58): eheh, yeah he was nice I didn't think that he would reply so promptly :)
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (18:59): Yeah, and now they're looking at a live CD for testing HW compatibility (HCTS)
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:00): Which is a perfect use for live media
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:01): The possibilities are endless -- as they've already discovered in the Linux arena

d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (19:05): a little more "environment" is needed, well, like to being able to update the skeleton/packages when a new build comes out, and then rebuild the iso, in a seamless way...
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (19:05): but I've seen that's not too difficul since I already tried with b46 and it worked out of the box, even if the scripts were for b44
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (19:06): I have a little fear over b47 because of the flag days I've read about...
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (19:06): I don't know if it's like in obsd that all the binaries stop working and so on...
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:07): I think flag days  only affect you if you're BFU'ing.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (19:08): sickness, only new stuff breaks on  flag days, the ghosts of sysadmins past protect the old code ;-p
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:09): Binaries should not stop working, that's for sure.
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:10): morning eric
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:10): early riser, eh?

a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:10): usually one of the first people in MPK17 :-P
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:11): my fiancee has to be at work by 5:30, so i tend to wake up with her
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:11): Eek, and I thought I had it bad getting the kids off to school ~7am
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (19:18): love is a powerful motivation.
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:19): jteo: that and beating traffic coming down 880
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (19:19): love is the lack of ability to see the other person's flaws ;)
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:19): love is managing not to strangle your dog after he's taken a crap in your favourite shoes
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:20): i mean seriously. you have to aim to get your poop in a shoe
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:20): stevel: Your shoes really take a beating! :)
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:20): fortunately they're very washable :)
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:22): Our dog pees/poops in the right places, but we can't seem to keep her from stealing/eating anything that seems like food off the coffee table.
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:23): Including chapstick and gum
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:23): Amazing it all just goe through her. Ate a whole box of crayons a few year ago!
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (19:23): our dog ate a whole costco pack of liquor filled chocolates
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:24): We had a laugh when she shit in technicolor
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (19:24): well, no, mine is a bit smarter and clasifies food.. though once she ate my brother's teethbrush
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:24): I could go for a few of those right now. Start the weekend early :-)
2d82904a705239de1641eb24ef9191cc (19:25): liquor filled chocolates that is, not crayola poop
6caff723a014fddb53dff9e10dd9e175 (19:26): glad you cleared that up :)
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (19:26): ohh, i thought you wanted crayola to have an excuse to leave early :)
